revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix
revision.text:

|brand = Aerohive |model = AP230 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = AC1750 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = access point |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = WBV-AP230 |icid = 7774A-AP230 |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM53016A1;BCM53016A1KFEBG; |cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = Cortex A9 |cpu1spd = 1.0 GHz <!-- 1.0 GHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Spansion;S34ML04G100TFI00; |flash1size = 512 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 256 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5TQ2G63FFR-PBC; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |lan_ports = 2 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 9C:5D:12 |oui = 9C:5D:12
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0, Mini PCIe |exp_minipcie_num = 2 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->

|serial = yes,, console port |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = <!-- default Login Name, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Wistron NeWeb |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Wistron NeWeb DNXB-M5I |rad1modif = Mini PCIe (oversized) |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43460;BCM43460KMLG, TE1340 P20, 324353 3 W; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad1ac = 1300 |nqam1 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
|wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = Wistron NeWeb DNXB-M2I |rad2modif = Mini PCIe (oversized) |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43460;BCM43460KMLG, TE1340 P20, 324353 3 W; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The wireless modules and antennas appear to bear '''WNC''' P/Ns on them. *"[G]48DNXBOF.SGB" and "2013.09.17" is silkscreened on the blue :2.4GHz wireless module (''[[Wistron NeWeb DNXB-M2I]]'') *"[G]48DNXB0I.SGB" is silkscreened on the bottom of the green :5GHz wireless module (''[[Wistron NeWeb DNXB-M5I]]'') :They may manufacture ''Wistron NeWeb'' the entire unit. {{see also|Wistron NeWeb}} Per the FCC EUT's label, a 9C:5D:12 OUI is assumed :to be used for at least some devices.
===Probable used PSU(s)=== The power supplies shown in the FCC photos are... *'''DVE''' DSA-24PFD-15 FUS 120200 {{hasPowerSupply |brand = DVE |model = DSA-24PFD-15 FUS 120200 |input_v=100-240 |input_a=0.8 |input_c=AC |input_hz=50-60 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=12 |output_a=2 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |countrymanuf = China |style=small, horiz. |e_level=5 }} *'''Powertron''' PA1024-2HUB / PA1024-120HUB200 {{hasPowerSupply |brand = Powertron |model = DSA-24PFD-15 FUS 120200 |input_v=100-240 |input_a=0.6 |input_c=AC |input_hz=50-60 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=12 |output_a=2 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |countrymanuf = China |style=small, horiz. |e_level=5 }}
